p: For the evaluation of the antimicrobial activity, the bacteria Staphylococcus aureus (ACTC 6538P), Escherichia coli (ATCC 8739) and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 25922) were used. The results were expressed as Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) and Minimum Bactericidal Concentration (MBC). MIC was determined by the serial dilution technique in 96-well plates, according to the methodology described in article M07-A10 of 38 manuals [ 57], with adaptations. To obtain the stock solution the polar solvent DMSO was used to aid in the dilution of the essential oil in distilled water. After this step, 50 μL of the T. diversifolia essential oil was added to the first well, with a concentration of 200 mg·mL −1.
